sentences.english: Is it true that using a headset makes you a safer driver?
sentences.chinese: 使用免持聽筒耳機就真的比較安全嗎？

sentences.english: Thing is, headphones don’t offer much warmth and getting cold ears isn’t fun.
sentences.chinese: 問題是，耳機不能保暖，耳朵越來越冷這就不好玩了。

sentences.english: For the speaker, the sensitivity at 1KHz and average sensitivity should be tested.
sentences.chinese: 測試耳機在1K赫茲時的靈敏度和平均靈敏度。

sentences.english: The newest high-end apartments on Mars are being marketed with a headphone closet.
sentences.chinese: 最新的火星高級公寓都要標榜自己有一個耳機櫃。

sentences.english: He clamped a pair of headphones over his ears.
sentences.chinese: 他把一副耳機呆在兩邊耳朵上。

sentences.english: A : May I use your earphone ?

sentences.chinese: 每個人要戴着耳機才能通話。

sentences.english: All Grado headphones have a vented diaphragm design that incorporates a large air chamber.
sentences.chinese: 所有歌德耳機有一個發泄隔膜設計，採用了大型氣室。

sentences.english: Check for looseness in front and headset bearings.
sentences.chinese: 檢查鬆動在前面的耳機軸承。

sentences.english: This is the communication headset you'll see on lots of space suits.
sentences.chinese: 這是通訊耳機，你可以在很多的太空服上看到。

sentences.english: Just use a wired headset or the speakerphone function,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 使用有線耳機或擴音器功能，就能達到預防目的。

sentences.english: Do you recommend any particular brand as an aftermarket remplacement cable for the sennheiser ?
sentences.chinese: 對於深海鯊魚耳機線你有什麼特別推薦？

sentences.english: She recommends that people use hands-free devices at all times, and when talking, hold the phone away from one's body.
sentences.chinese: 她推薦人們全程使用耳機，通話時電話離開身體。
這是我新的耳機收音機。

sentences.english: Those who specialize in simultaneous interpretations do so with the use of an ear piece and a microphone.
sentences.chinese: 同聲傳譯人員使用耳機和麥克風來實現傳譯。

sentences.english: Many higher-priced, high-fidelity earphones can sound harsh playing digital music.
sentences.chinese: 很多更高價的高保真耳機聽數碼音樂時會刺耳。

definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
camera lens/camera shot (in a movie etc)/scene
speech sounds/pronunciation/colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character/phonetic/audio/voice/(Internet) to voice chat/voice message
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
